title: Ticket #5053: condor_q -g showing duplicates
description:
I'm seeing some weirdness in condor_q in master (but not in 8.3.5).

It seems that some internal job buffer isn't cleared between schedds, leading to repetitive results. See below example; there's really only two schedds with matching jobs, yet 5 schedd's worth of results are returned (three are identical). 

$ condor_q -g -pool vocms097.cern.ch -const 'WMAgent_RequestName=?="pdmvserv_FSQ-RunIISpring15DR74-00007_00008_v0_castor_150511_172908_7320"'


-- Schedd: vocms0310.cern.ch : <128.142.209.47:4080?noUDP&sock=1331419_9578_3>
 ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD
53665.0   cmst1           5/13 07:23   0+00:30:26 R  30150000 390.6 submit.sh pdmvserv

1 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 0 idle, 1 running, 0 held, 0 suspended


-- Schedd: cmsgwms-submit2.fnal.gov : <131.225.205.13:9615?noUDP&sock=8719_66be_130>
 ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD
53665.0   cmst1           5/13 07:23   0+00:30:26 R  30150000 390.6 submit.sh pdmvserv

0 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 0 idle, 0 running, 0 held, 0 suspended

remarks:
2015-May-13 08:38:09 by bbockelm:
Confirmed this on a clean box using TimT's 8.3.6 release candidate RPMs.

2015-May-13 09:35:24 by johnkn:
Silly bug. the guts of the clear_results() were wrong (and also commented out.) <sigh>
check_ins: 2015-May-13 10:16   Check-in [44845]: fix for condor_q -global showing duplicates #5053 ===VersionHistory:None=== bug never shipped. (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
